alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Fentress; Overton; Pickett; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Overton, central Pickett, northern Cumberland, southeastern Putnam and Fentress Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Byrdstown to near Monterey. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jamestown, Fairfield Glade, Monterey, Allardt, Grimsley, Slate Springs, Clarkrange, Crawford, Pickett State Park and Pall Mall. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 298 and 316. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
